headline: FedEx and UPS Shares Fall After White House Sets End Date for ‘De Minimis’ Rule
summary: Shares of UPS and FedEx slid Wednesday after the White House said that the U.S. would end the de minimis rule that has allowed packages worth $800 or less to be imported duty-free.  It had already halted the practice for Chinese goods in May.  Shares of FedEx fell 4.6% and shares of UPS were down 4%.

raw.headline: FedEx and UPS Shares Fall After White House Sets End Date for ‘De Minimis’ Rule
raw.summary: Shares of UPS and FedEx slid Wednesday after the White House said that the U.S. would end the de minimis rule that has allowed packages worth $800 or less to be imported duty-free.  It had already halted the practice for Chinese goods in May.  Shares of FedEx fell 4.6% and shares of UPS were down 4%.

headline: UPS Stock Joins 7% Dividend Yielders in S&P 500. Here’s Who Else Is in That Club.
summary: United Parcel Service  has joined the 7% yield club in the S&P 500.  The stock’s yield surpassed that rare level on Tuesday, after the logistics company’s disappointing second-quarter profit report triggered a 10% slide in the shares.  There are now four others in the index with 7%-plus yields:  Pfizer Conagra Brands LyondellBasell Industries  and  Healthpeak Properties  according to data from S&P Dow Jones Indices.

headline: BofA lowers UPS rating to Neutral on uncertain outlook, slow cost-cutting
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America (BofA) Securities on Tuesday downgraded United Parcel Service Inc (NYSE:UPS) shares to Neutral from Buy, flagging a clouded outlook and slow progress on cost-cutting initiatives.

headline: First-Time Business Owners Open New PostalAnnex Location in Lafayette, Louisiana
summary: Annex Brands, Inc., one of the leading franchisors in the packing, shipping and office services industries, is proud to announce the opening of its newest PostalAnnex location in Lafayette, LA to owners Shane and Chrissi Broussard. This new PostalAnnex is set to offer a wide range of essential services to the community, including shipping, mailbox rentals, and office services.

headline: Stock Index Futures Gain Ahead of U.S. GDP Data and Fed Rate Decision, Microsoft and Meta Earnings on Tap
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are up +0.12%, and September Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQU25) are up +0.21% this morning, pointing to a slightly higher open on Wall Street, while investors await the Federal Reserve’s policy decision, a fresh batch of U.S. economic data, including the ADP employment report and the first estimate of second-quarter GDP, as well as earnings reports from “Magnificent Seven” companies Microsoft and Meta.

headline: UPS China-to-US Shipments Decline More than Expected in Q2
summary: The courier saw volumes on the trade lane drop 35 percent in May and June as tariffs and the end of the de minimis provision hamper parcel shipping for small packages.

raw.headline: UPS China-to-US Shipments Decline More than Expected in Q2
raw.summary: The courier saw volumes on the trade lane drop 35 percent in May and June as tariffs and the end of the de minimis provision hamper parcel shipping for small packages.
